JobFullDesc: Are you a creative thinker and talented problem solver who has learned to balance vision with pragmatism to bring your ideas into fruition? Do you enjoy thinking about problems that scale and envisioning what the future can offer? We’re looking for an engineer with design chops or strong design sensibilities with a passion for high-fidelity interactions. This role works in a people-centric and culture-first collaborative environment alongside UI/UX designers, product designers, engineers, strategists, and writers to design and implement best-in-class modern experiences for the world tomorrow supported by thoughtful and intentional technology tomorrow. A "design technologist" on this team is similar to a “UX engineer” or “design engineer” – but of course, this role is unique to each team, company, and individual. You will be involved in both design and engineering processes. We’re the Innovation & Technology team -- a forward-looking team passionate about building innovative technology, implementing delightful designs, saving designers and engineers time through design tooling, prototyping, and automation, as well as working on building the future vision of the next generation of Microsoft products. Our team consists of folks with diverse backgrounds in engineering, design, the sciences, law, and medicine; we come in all shapes and sizes. We love innovating and pushing the boundaries of technology and being a critical part of the Microsoft Design system, which touches many of the popular and well-loved Microsoft products (Teams, Office, Azure, Xbox, and so on).   If you’re looking for a change and wanting to make an impact – we invite you to join us in our mission and vision to build the future of UX for Microsoft.   About you You’re a self-driven, talented engineer who’s passionate about how design comes to life - a thoughtful and inclusive collaborator who is able to bring folks along the journey in striving for product excellence, and a nimble developer with keen design sensibilities. You have experience interpreting designs into fully functional interactive experiences, and quickly learning new tools and technologies, and aren’t afraid to dive into the unknown. Best of all, you understand and appreciate the design process and know how to merge that knowledge with established development processes.  You’ll nurture and evolve our culture. You’ll design in the open to move fast and build experiences without seams. You’ll share, jam, and contribute to other’s work to make it better. You’ll make to think, prototype to test.    Don’t feel like you need to fit into a predefined box matching the role you’re applying for—you never know where the true opportunity may go after we meet you. We’ll provide you with unparalleled levels of opportunity and resources, with the goal of creating experiences that influence the industry, as well as people’s lives.  A day in the life Think through complex problem spaces and drive clarity in ambiguous spaces Ideate and brainstorm about new innovative technology solutions to various design and engineering problems Make designs delightful and real through prototypes and code, and iterate on these designs to make them really shineOffer constructive feedback followed by creative and effective solutions Communicate to stakeholders when technology constraints require design or engineering compromises Follow best practices and provide code review feedback to your peers Collaborate with others to bring ideas to life and create prototypes that convey experience intentions when static comps can’t tell the whole story Communicate clearly and concisely with stakeholders ResponsibilitiesOther success factors in our dynamic environment: Thoughtfulness—You’re thoughtful and deliberate in your choices and able to articulate that on the fly across a cross-functional team, and occasionally, conflicting priorities and objectives. Bigger picture – Understands how to prevent short-term work from blocking long-term goals.  Need to be able to move very fast without coding/designing in a way that inhibits our future needs or others’ efforts. Business intelligence + persuasion skills—You’ve got the social intelligence and business saavy to understand (or explain) what needs to be changed, prioritized, and why. You use criticism to spur insightful conversations instead of be defensive or shut down. A translator of tradeoffs—There’s no perfect design or implementation, and no right answer. You’re able to create different options and translate the tradeoffs between them in the context of business impact. A facilitator—You know how to collaborate with others and let them put their concerns on the table. Self-awareness – You pay attention to how you impact team health and culture, as well as your personal well-being. We value folks who care about others, and who make sure to take time for themselves and for self-care.  QualificationsMinimum of 3-5 years of engineering or development skills, OR significant industry experience uniquely qualifying you for this role Experience working on the UI/UX of a product Strong attention to detail and your own brand of craftsmanship Ability to collaborate and work effectively cross functionally with other teams (Design, Research, Engineering, PM)  GitHub, CodePen, or other links showcasing your skills OR a UI/UX portfolio is required A solid grasp of core front-end technologies is preferred, but not required Experience working with data, data visualization, or AI/ML is a bonus, but *not required Desirable skills & experience:  Passion for invention, human-computer interaction, and seamless user experiences Strong interest and understanding in regards to enabling User Research through prototyping. Strong understanding of production requirements and the willingness to steer work to minimize negative impact Confident presenting and promoting design solutions The ability to wear many hats and contribute across disciplines A history of designing delightful interactive experiences Experience working with a multi-disciplinary team of designers and developers Self-motivated and comfortable with the ambiguities inherent in incubation work Strong brainstorming skills, from participation to leadership A strong interest in design, technology, and trends, with an eye toward the future Knowledge of Microsoft Azure services or AI/ML is a bonus, but not required #MDS#joinXC Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
